answers.answer: Hello, without being personally involved in your case, I cannot make any surgical recommendations.However, I can comment on the fevers - that should be further investigated.  This is especially important in the presence of diabetes.  Abscesses from the surgery should be considered - an abdominal/pelvic CT scan would be a reasonable first step.  Another test would be a tagged white cell study if the fevers continue.Regarding the self-catheterization, if there isn't an acceptable surgical solution, a suprapubic catheter (i.e. a permanent catheter) can be considered in place of intermittent self-catheterization.Another opinion by a urologist at an academic medical center should beconsidered.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.Medical Weblog:kevinmd_b
